body: I have no words... This doujin depicts the horrors of war and the after effects of it so well. There is no Victors in War, the only ones who come out of it are the people that suffers because of it. This also gives a little bit of a history lesson on how Berlin was Captured by the Soviets and i also liked the Downfall Reference. With all that said, War is NEVER the answer to anything. And the conflict going on in Europe today only proves it. I hope nothing like this ever happens again and i pray for everyone who is currently suffering from war the very best.

This is one of the best Doujins hands down. And I have extremely high standards. This one gets a 12/10. It suffices every category that I look for.

Goodbye Yukiyukite Senshadou. You'll be remembered.

It takes a very skilled artist and writer to make something that evokes a feeling of terrible dread in a reader. So while yes, this story will make you feel terrible, especially since most of us are already familiar with these characters. But, that shouldn't take away from the fact that this is a good story that is well written and displays a truly bleak view of war through the lenses of cute anime girls. This is not a hentai, this is a war story that just so happens to have some yuri in it in order to drive home the point that war, is far worse than anything Hell could offer. In Hell, only the evil are punished; in war, everyone is punished.
War is hell.
wholesome

The “berg” and “fluss” scene in page 63 is a Countersign, a sign, word, or any other signal previously agreed upon and required to be exchanged between a sentry or guard and anybody approaching his or her post. The term usually encompasses both the sign given by the approaching party as well as the sentry's reply. However, in some armies, the countersign is strictly the reply of the sentry to the password given by the person approaching.

Sensing a sincere apprehension in the recommendation, I started at the end pages before reading the entire series in order. Having gone through it, I must say that yes, this needs to exist. In this site, of all places, may it never be taken down.

I actually have the complete tank (no pun intended) of the 3 doujins that make up this story.  Apparently TK wasn't satisfied with some of the parts cause my version more parts some scene featured in 3 separate release are longer in complete collection I hold. As brutal and dark as story is across then 3 separate doujins the complete collection goes the extra mile (eg: in complete collection the panels on what is page 57 in this, actually show Miho's poor crew being much more bloody and messed up, I mean Reizei alone is shown graphically to have a hole blown through her back, where as in this version she just shown to be a bit bloody). This is a very interesting spin on the series, personally I enjoyed dark gritty nature of it all, war is hell.
